channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Venezuela approves amnesty that may release of hundreds detained for political reasons
item.description: Venezuela's acting president has signed into law an amnesty bill that could lead to the release of politicians, activists, lawyers and many others. The approval marks a stark turn for the nation.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela's acting president has signed into law an amnesty bill that could lead to the release of politicians, activists, lawyers and many others. The approval marks a stark turn for the nation.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: There's outrage in Ukraine as Russian athletes are allowed to compete in Paralympics
item.description: The International Paralympic Committee decided to allow six Russian and four Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flags in Italy. The decision has caused an outcry in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: The International Paralympic Committee decided to allow six Russian and four Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flags in Italy. The decision has caused an outcry in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Polina Lytvynova

item.title: Family of Virginia Giuffre reacts to arrest of former Prince Andrew
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Sky and Amanda Roberts, family members of the late Virginia Giuffre, now that the former Prince Andrew has been arrested by police in the U.K.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Sky and Amanda Roberts, family members of the late Virginia Giuffre, now that the former Prince Andrew has been arrested by police in the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. SÃ¡nchez

item.title: 1,000 Kenyans were recruited to fight for Russia in Ukraine, intelligence report says
item.description: A new Kenyan intelligence report said the Kenyans were recruited to fight for Russia in Ukraine after being misled with false promises of jobs in Russia before being sent to the front lines.
item.content:encoded:
A new Kenyan intelligence report said the Kenyans were recruited to fight for Russia in Ukraine after being misled with false promises of jobs in Russia before being sent to the front lines.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Police arrest Ex-Prince Andrew. And, Trump hosts the first Board of Peace meeting
item.description: U.K. police arrested Former Prince Andrew today on suspicion of misconduct in public office, U.K. media reports. And, President Trump is hosting the first-ever Board of Peace meeting today.
item.content:encoded:
U.K. police arrested Former Prince Andrew today on suspicion of misconduct in public office, U.K. media reports. And, President Trump is hosting the first-ever Board of Peace meeting today.

(Image credit: Allison Robbert)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: President Trump's Board of Peace will meet for the first time Thursday
item.description: As President Trump's Board of Peace prepares to meet for the first time Thursday, he says the group has raised $5 billion for Gaza reconstruction. But key challenges remain.
item.content:encoded: As President Trump's Board of Peace prepares to meet for the first time Thursday, he says the group has raised $5 billion for Gaza reconstruction. But key challenges remain.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Can President Trump's Board of Peace bring lasting peace to Gaza?
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Middle East expert Aaron David Miller of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about the prospect of lasting peace in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Middle East expert Aaron David Miller of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about the prospect of lasting peace in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: U.K.'s ex-Prince Andrew is released after his arrest over Epstein revelations
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the British former prince, was released after spending the day in police custody but is still under investigation on suspicion of misconduct in public office.
item.content:encoded:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the British former prince, was released after spending the day in police custody but is still under investigation on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Former South Korean President Yoon sentenced to life for imposing martial law
item.description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was sentenced to life in prison Thursday for imposing martial law to suppress the opposition in December 2024.
item.content:encoded: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was sentenced to life in prison Thursday for imposing martial law to suppress the opposition in December 2024.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Trump administration balances Ukraine talks and Russia deal prospects
item.description: The U.S. concluded another round of talks to end the war in Ukraine as the White House pressured Ukraine while exploring potential business opportunities with Russia amid a reported economic proposal.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. concluded another round of talks to end the war in Ukraine as the White House pressured Ukraine while exploring potential business opportunities with Russia amid a reported economic proposal.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes
